paragraphs: Fragment of Petition of Abraham Lincoln and Others to Unknown, [1848]1

We concur in the above–A Lincoln,Ills.R W ThompsonJ. Dixon–Conn.P W TompkinsJames WilsonN,H,J–    E– BradyRobt L RoseA R McIlvaineJohn W JonesGideon ReynoldsD S GregoryE SherrillCornsWarrenP H SilvesterN. EvansDudley MarvinJno.P.GainesD. B. St JohnGeo. G. DunnJohn  I. SlingerlandE. B. HolmesWmT. HaskellH. S CongerJohn Van DykeW NelsonC S MoreheadJohn FreedleyW CollinsHiram BelcherGreen AdamsWmA NewellM. HamptonE. D. Baker2

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote the line of concurrence and signed his name.  Each signatory
                  signed his own name.  The actual petition has not been identified or located.
2With the exception of William Collins, all the signatories wereWhigmembers of theU.S. House of Representativesduring theThirtieth Congress.
